name: Web3 social for Zuzalu
info: All good. Thanks.
description:
If blockchain is changing the way we cooperate globally, then Web3 social could be the future of online communication. Today we’re always a click away from being de-platformed by centralized social networks. Web3 social could become a “credible neutral” basis for our communication and online collaboration. But the decentralized nature of these networks also raises important questions about data privacy, ownership and governance that we must address.

Sever and Martin are working at the AKASHA Foundation. Since releasing our first experiment, the on-chain AKASHA app in 2017 the space has evolved quite a bit. We see different protocols popping up such as Farcaster, ATProtocol (bluesky), Nostr….

We would like to invite you to a brainstorming workshop discussing all about Web3 social this Thursday, March 30 from 5 to 6pm.

Here’a s list of topics we could cover - but feel free to also bring your own: 

- What does Web3/ decentralized social really mean?
- What is minimal viable decentralization?
- Comparing existing protocols for new social apps (federated vs decentralized) …and why/ do we need so many?
- What governance (DAOs) and moderating for new online communities do we need?
- What might a Zuzalu native social app look like?
- ...

Where? 
We are in apartment C904. The best way to get there is through our terrace next to the outdoor pool. We posted a map in the #web3-social channel on discord.

name: Future of Zuzalu (and forks)
equipment: Ability to do slide presentations / share screen
description:
A collaborative session, with both presentations and tools like sli.do and pol.is, to gain a better understanding of what Zuzaluans want out of possible future rounds of the concept, as well as a deep dive into economic and other practicalities. Intended as a "round 1". Topics may include:

* What long-term things do people want? A permanent crypto+bio+philosophy town in Montenegro? A roaming nomad village? Once a year, or year round? Multiple forks?
* The economics of organizing, including costs and how to achieve economic sustainability, saving money by mass booking off-peak, etc
* The logistics and other practical complexities of organizing
* The tradeoffs of independent resorts vs "embedded inside a town"
* Which countries to go to
* Social tradeoffs: how to balance being inclusive and not becoming an elite enclave, vs keeping the number of sketchy people, aggressive and power-seeking people, etc down. Should there be resident vs visitor distinctions, what should those look like? etc
* Governance

info: Part of Public Goods week schedule
description: This talk will give an overview of Protocol Guild: a mechansism to route donations from the Ethereum community to core protocol maintainers in an incentive-compatible way. We will first decribe what Protocol Guild is & how it works, then go over the initial PG pilot, future plans for the guild, and finally answer audience questions.

name: Public Goods Funding: the Race to the Bottom
description: Gitcoin will walk us through its funding details to date and explore how we might identify sustainable, recurring revenue sources for public goods in the future. You won’t want to miss it.

name: Public Goods Public Perception
info: white board, pens, markers, microphone
description:
Public Goods” is at risk of becoming a catch-all term, and the more successful genuine efforts are, the more likely it is to attract grifters.  How can we better frame what we mean by public goods? Where/how should the Ethereum community draw the line, and how can we design related incentives to achieve better support for them?

Join the teams from Gitcoin, Supermodular, Protocol Labs, and Optimism as we discuss the current perception of Public Goods and collabratively work towards solutions to the problems we are facing.

name: Goals for Public Goods Funding
description:
Join us for a conversation outlining the full stack of the public goods ecosystem, and learn how you can plug in to help move the ecosystem forward.

Themes:

The why and how of unified interfaces/taxonomies/structures for decision and funding-allocation mechanisms, and:

  • What that means for hackers and researchers
  • How that can be made regenerative (tldr: by facilitating external use cases)
  • Emerging primitives for public goods

name: Shapella fork party
description:
The Shapella fork, whose flagship feature is enabling ETH stakers to withdraw (see https://blog.ethereum.org/2023/03/28/shapella-mainnet-announcement), is taking place at 22:27 UTC on Apr 12 (that's 00:27 local time on Apr 13). We can watch the fork happening live, and talk about what is going into the fork, some technical details and some questions about what is likely to happen to the Ethereum base layer in the next few forks in the future.

Actual time for this would be 23:45 Apr 12 - 01:00 Apr 13 local time, in the coworking space aka ballroom.

name: Presenting Michael Smith - Inventor of a revolutionary regenerative technology (Regen AI - DeSci - Blockchain - Public good)
info: Please help me get people to this. It’s important and mind blowing.
equipment: Big screen. Ability to zoom. We need it recorded.
description:
Michael Smith is the Inventor of the Earth Power Lodge which was showcased in a documentary that won over ten awards and has more than 25,000,000 views. 

His invention turns biomass waste into power, organic food, fertilizer and soil amendments while purifying water and sequestering CO2. His system uses AI ML. He's keen on open source decentralization. 

You don't want to miss this talk. It's a game changer.

To top it off you can build one of these things starting at around 2million and do 4million in revenue the first year - while doing amazing things for the planet.

We are incredibly fortunate that he's making time to present to us. Please join in. He will zoom into the Dome.

name: Philosophy Discussion on Death & Meaning of Life
info: Join us for a thought-provoking small group discussion on Death & Meaning of Life! This will be the first in a series of discussions exploring some fundamental questions about what it means to be alive. We'll start by exploring why we fear death, what death means to us, and the nature of immortality. No philosophy background is needed; anyone who is curious about these questions is welcome to join. Please note that sign-ups are limited to 10 people on a first-come-first-serve basis.

name: Deploy your own on-chain zkml models with ezkl
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great! Screen or projector and a whiteboard with markers
description:
Running ai/ml models in a zero-knowledge proof makes it as though they run on chain. This lets the chain perceive the world and gives smart contracts the ability to exercise judgement. Learn how to take your own ML models and turn them into provers and on-chain verifiers using our open-source tool ezkl (https://github.com/zkonduit/ezkl). Beginner-friendly, but we will also delve into some technical and mathematical details for the interested.

Target audience: People who are new to ZK but who have a technical background, or are experienced with ZK and are curious about the technical details of how ezkl works.

name: Intro: Folding Scheme Math Building Blocks

equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Nova’s [KST21] folding scheme is a lightweight protocol for recursive proof composition. This session lays the mathematical groundwork for understanding the components of a folding scheme, and introduces the contexts in which it is useful. We will cover primitives such as vector commitment schemes, random linear combinations, the Fiat-Shamir transform, as well as incrementally verifiable computation and zk-SNARKs on a high level.

name: Blockchain use case in Africa
info: I need builders, the community to attend so we can have a fruitful conversation and have a roadmap to scale the use case in Africa.
description:
I am the founder of ayaversity.com; we are primarily focused on early-stage companies. Aya has a unique approach that harnesses talent with a startup mindset through our Ethereum-focused training in smart contact, product design, and product management, utilizing soulbound NFTs powered by blockchain technology to create social identities for each candidate to build their on-chain proof of work.

I am one of those who believe Ethereum and its ecosystem must have a plan for Africa in real-time. This is why, Africa has the world's youngest population and has an actual use case for blockchain. It is nice to have it in the West. I'm not technical, but my ideals have impacted 33 African countries. So I will be happy to see the possibility of having a session to discuss “Blockchain as a need-use case for Africa." 

-"How do we empower 10 million young Africans with the key skills to contribute and build scaleable solutions on Ethereum, Layer 2, and other EVMs?"

- How to use community building to make EF have a strong physical penetration in the continent that has real use cases for the technology.

The next billion users are tied to millions with digital knowledge and skills. Africa will play this key role in utility, usability, and adoption.

see you at the dome.

name: Embodiment Weekend - Opening Ceremony

description:
LilaB - Laboratory of Embodiment and Movement: A wild combination of yoga techniques, movement research and ecstatic practices.

Welcome are so excited to announce the upcoming embodiment workshop, LilaB, a laboratory of embodiment and movement.
This is designed for people of all backgrounds, age, gender identity and experience levels. 

Embodiment is the practice of exploring the connection between your body and mind. It's about bringing your attention to your physical sensations, emotions, and movements, and using them to deepen your understanding of yourself and your interactions with others. 

In these workshops, you will have the opportunity to learn about embodiment through a variety of exercises and activities over a period of 4 days, held at Zuzalu. We will guide you through practices such as breathwork, movement, meditation, and mindfulness, all of which are designed to help you tune in to your body and cultivate awareness.

We hope that if you join, you commit to the entire experience - from opening ceremony to closing ceremony. Growth happens best in community, ritual, vulnerability, depth and practice and there will be people who are trained to hold you in your deepest moments. Moving your body can bring up emotions that have been suppressed, and finally give them expression. Express and release. We all have pent up emotions. You are not alone. These emotions deserve to be expressed, they deserve to have a voice and a movement, and ohhhh does it feel good.  

No prior experience is required, and we welcome individuals of all levels of fitness and ability. Our facilitators will be on hand to offer guidance and support throughout the workshop.

Come join us and explore the fascinating world of embodiment!

name: Powdr - a framework for zkVMs
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Powdr (https://github.com/chriseth/powdr) is a language and compiler framework for zkVMs. It provides a tooling stack for user-defined zkISAs relying on execution traces with lookups. Powdr provides an assembly and a polynomial identity languages, where constant polynomials are defined in the language itself. Witnesses are generated deterministically and automatically during the compilation process. As a PoC, we have implemented a subset of RISCV in Powdr, where you can make ZKPs about no-std Rust programs directly.

name: Poseidon: The Missing Infra for Building zkDApps
info: There will be two people calling in via zoom
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description:
In this workshop, we present Poseidon, the missing infra for building zkDApps on Ethereum. Poseidon provides three things: 1) composable ZKP primitives as smart contract so that DApp developers don’t have to write ZKP circuits on their own. 2) DApp SDK that helps the DApp developers build ZKP proof generation on client side (e.g. browser). 3) ZK-ZK Aggregator that aggregates a batch of client generated proofs into a single proof so that the amortized ZKP verification cost (gas cost) can be greatly reduced.

The workshop will include talks about the architecture, demos of building zkDApps, and panel discussion about co-processor architecture.

Audience: People who are interested in ZK technology, Ethereum Developers that don't know too much about ZK but want to build zkDApps.

Criteria we are taking into account include:

description:
Marijana Lemm and Jasmine Alakari will lead a talk on the ecological potentials of Montenegro, focused around the Tara and Moraca river.

The challenge is to think about how we can develop tools through blockchain and AI for the management of natural ecosystems and resources, rethink existing and ineffective governance and regulatory structures to create a sustainable, resilient, and biodiverse future.


Our partners have already protected one river in Albania, and we are developing the next project with a replicable system to protect the wild rivers in Montenegro.

We invite you for an open discussion on how we can harness the power of new technologies in creating future standards for environmental protection. If we figure out how to protect the veins of the world globally, the implications for future generations would be unprecedented.

Everyone reads a chapter and next week we meet up for everyone to pitch their chapter and their insights in 5min.

As a supporting tool we had the idea of using Memex to collaboratively annotate the chapters of the book. (https://memex.garden)

Since today, also the web annotator is live, so no need to install any extra software. 

I made a short video that explains how to use it https://share.descript.com/view/fVDrUm7WGBX 

Next steps: 

1. Go to the Network State Bookclub Space: https://memex.social/c/WB31lokfosswgn88kViE?key=wCo8h4JfoNFKPKxGqNNf  

2. Accept the invite to the Memex Space

3. Pick a chapter of the book you want to read

name: Sociocracy for a Network State Alliance
equipment: Microphone, screen for slides, audio to play a video on the screen. If there's potential to record this talk that would be wonderful. However, I think I should be able figure out all these things without any issues assuming the cable is there to plug in my laptop and the mic is working.
description: We will discuss how the Amazonian Woarani people organize through federations, how the Ashaninka indigenous people won a war using bows and arrows in the 90s against terrorists using community engagement, and how three million Kurds in northern Syria won against ISIS and established an autonomous region using sociocracy with zero central government. Then we shall consider how we might use these principles to form a network state alliance.

description:
Capoeira is a martial art/game/dance/cultural tradition that was born in Brazil amidst the encounter of many African cultures in the forced diaspora. The way I see it, it's a body/energy/spiritual practice suitable for anyone. It's also very playful.

In this session I hope to share basic movements and context for this practice - as well as some of its music. Participants will be able to do exercise and play in a Capoeira "roda" (Capoeira circle).

Here's a video with two great living master of this art (from the "Angola tradition") playing together:

name: Open sourcing healthcare is saving lives while creating a new health ecosystem
description: Join this lively discussion with Dave Chase, cofounder of Health Rosetta, which aims to accelerate the adoption of simple, practical, non-partisan fixes to our healthcare system. Even if healthcare isn't your issue, it's undermining your causes. Despite the challenges, a movement is succeeding in changing the most influential sector in the US. A new community/ecosystem has rewritten national rules and laws as well as the secret "laws" that govern this enterprise. This new movement can save lives and even entire communities when it operates as a coordin-nation.

name: Mini Think Tank: Using Crypto X AI to amplify environmental protection
description:
The climate crisis is a crisis of culture and thus of imagination. Join us for an intimate brainstorm and small group disucssion session over two hours where we will seek to come up with compelling answers and ideas that address the following quesions:


What novel fundraising models for protecting the natural world do blockchains, cryptocurrencies, NFTs, etc unlock?

How can we gamify nature conservation? 

How can we enable transparent, decentralised governance over natural resources with with AI, crypto, or a combination of both?

How can we tokenise wild rivers, forests, etc,  and incentivise people to care for them?

Can rivers, forests, marshlands, etc be given their own "voice" by combning NPLs/AI with live imperical data from those things?


Technical and non-technical folks welcome. A positive outcome of this woud be well-though out and comprehensive answers to any or all these questions that could serve as seeds for larger projects, hackathon concepts, and/or ongoing discussions groups in the future.

Therefore, we will host a session for "letting your ideas go 🚀". Share your ideas and inspire others who may have the time and desire to pick them up and make them a reality.

No pitch decks or presentations are needed. We will conduct an open conversation, ask some questions and try to refine ideas together.

name: The Class with Natalie Kuhn
description:
What is The Class? The Class is a fun and challenging workout that combines strength-training, cardio, and mindfulness to help you feel better.

The practice is mat-based and music-driven. We repeat one move per song to create sensation in the body and observe our thoughts. In any given Class students can expect guided instruction and a carefully curated playlist to lead them through exercises they are familiar with such as—squats, jumping jacks, and burpees.


The result is a mental clearing and emotional release. Through continued practice, students develop tools to empower their life, along with an incredibly strong, resilient, body.

name: Get Drafted into the fight against Climate Change
description:
Whether you are new to climate issues or a world-renowned expert, you’ll find this time informative, fun, and inspiring.

Joel Wish is the co-founder of an organization called Climate Draft that educates, inspires, and activates the best and brightest minds around the world to work on the climate crisis. If you are worried about the changes our planet is going through and wondering what you and technology can do about it, this event is for you!  


Schedule:

- (20min) Learn about where all this carbon is coming from at a scientific level (guest video by Peter Barrett from Playground Global)
- Showcasing some of the most promising climate technology companies and why what they are working on is interesting (Joel Wish)
- Group Q&A 
- Breakout discussions with participants and prompts designed to get you thinking about how you can contribute!

You’ll also get access to 10hrs of free coursework designed to go even deeper on where your skills can be applied to the greatest challenge of our time. If you can’t attend the event, signup as a participant at climatedraft.org (http://climatedraft.org) and click on “Learn”.

name: [Breakfast Roundtable] Meta-verse Mavericks #1 - The Future of AI in Web3 and Beyond
equipment: We scouted the location, we'd like to occupy the deck on the water-side (facing the cave). The corner in the back, joining the two last tables together + seating for 12~15 people would be enough.
description:
( Kiki's restaurant outside. the deck on the waterside, facing the cave )



Artificial Intelligence has been spinning the world on its head. While some speculate that AGI has already arrived, thought leaders in the field have taken a more nuanced stance.


Whether or not the world will soon be dominated by flying, crawling, swimming, shapeshifting - autonomous intelligent terminator robots…


Queena Tsai [ Co-Founder rct AI // Forbes 30U30 ] and Yannick Myson [ Brand Lead @ Delysium & Lucy-AI ] would like to invite the movers and shakers in AI x Crypto to a free-for-all round table discussion.


For the past 4 years, we’ve been building AI-powered tools that help shape the foundational building blocks of the Meta-verse.


Our backers, like Y-Combinator and Makers Fund, have graciously contributed to the swift development of our award-winning products.



The most recent edition to our Delysium’s multiverse is Lucy OS.



Lucy is an AI-powered Web3 virtual assistant that can help you learn about the latest projects, manage your assets and perform transactions without the hassle.



Within the first 20 days after launch, Lucy’s user base grew to over 1.2 million. This has demonstrated the bullish perspective the Web3 space has on AI.



As we quickly travel through the elbow curve of technological advancement, our decisions become increasingly important.



We wish to leave a lasting positive impact on the world.



This first edition of Meta-verse Mavericks is a light-hearted initiative to bring together the right minds:



Together we’ll embark on a journey into the depths of our fields, exploring the exciting new frontiers of AI in Web3, the Meta-verse, and beyond.



We want to create lasting serendipitous encounters that spark new ideas and collaborations that help society navigate this new ocean of opportunity.



If you’re active in building Web3, AI, Meta-verse, or anything in the direction thereof, you’re most welcome to join us.


Delysium Twitter 

Chat with Lucy 

rct AI

name: Hack your own genome workshop, part I
equipment: Just projector, first part is theoretical
description:
The first part of the hack-your-own-genome workshop explains:

* How and where can I sequence your genome?

* How do health and longevity are connected with genetics? Which longevity genes do I have?

* How can I analyze my or somebodies genome with open-source tools and libraries?

* When I see an exciting gene or gene variant, how can I check it in my genome and interpret my genotype?

* Most of the traits are polygenic. How can I evaluate my polygenic risk scores

* Which types of genomic apps exist?

The talk will heavily utilize http://dna-seq.github.io/ open-source tools and apps that we develop.

name: Why Decentralizing AI Matters + Free Access to a No Code AI App Builder
description:
Running a data labelling team of 70 people from developing countries feels great. People will tell you that they are less stressed about rent, that they can pay for college now, and can take care of their kids better.

But six months after building this team, the company I worked at had a potential contract from an advertisement firm that said it could use our AI automations and then fire hundreds of their employees in the Philippines. 

The race is on to build systems that distribute the benefits of AI. 

How do we decentralize the data ownership, the compute, and the equity of AI? 

Are current efforts in AI safety centralizing AI in unhelpful ways? 

As well as presenting an overview of some of these questions, we will give free access to a proprietary no-code tool to easily prototype your own AI apps.

Rather than being in fear of being made irrelevant, we can empower people to be builders.

name: Think beyond the ‘Twitter box’; Reimagine social networks in the age of AI and Network States  & coordi-nations
equipment: yes we need zoom in people
description:
As we navigate the digital age, social media sites like X Corp. (formerly Twitter) have become integral to our online social interactions, shaping how we connect, communicate, and share information. Online communities depend on Web2 social media yet these services operate within certain limitations, pose constraints to users, and can even become a  threat to the communities that thrive on them. The recent wave of erratic decisions by Twitter’s new CEO highlights the platform’s vulnerability to individual whims and the potential for far-reaching consequences to its users. At the same time, AI is transforming and reshaping the way we interact and connect online posing new challenges for our human-social interactions. These actions have reignited questions and concerns about social media’s future, governance, and impact on public discourse.


We invite the researchers, creators and developers of new protocols and platforms to come together and discuss how we may overcome the inertia and cold start problems of new paradigms to grow the user base of a new, decentralized social web.

This series of discussions explores the current state and the exciting future of decentralized social media.

Are there alternative models and visions for online social interaction that can break free from the traditional framework of platforms like Twitter? 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2:00 PM - 2:40 PM
Panel 1: Beyond surveillance capitalism-based social media: The Cambrian explosion of new protocols and platforms
Panelists: Stani or Nader, Vitalik, Suji, Mihai, Primavera

  • A retrospective on Twitter's journey and other social media giants
  • Exploring the diversity of decentralized social platforms and protocols
  • Examining the key differentiators and value propositions of emerging platforms
  • Discussing the potential and opportunities for the next generation of social media

2:40 PM - 2:50 PM
Break

2:50 PM - 3:20 PM
Panel 2: The foundational technology stack for Web3 social
Panelists: Nader, Yisi, Mihai, Sever
Moderator: Martin

  • Technical standards: Content and social portability/DIDs etc.
  • Embracing Onchain Identity: The Role of universal, censorship-resistant name services in personalizing and authenticating a new social presence
  • The role of Ethereum in enabling decentralized social interactions

3:20 PM - 3:30 PM
Break

3:30 PM - 4:00 PM

Panel 3: How meta-aggregation of credentials enables a new wave of social cryptoPanelists: Reka, Gary, Joel, Adam, Laura
Moderator: Raz

  • What are the potential implications and benefits of integrating many social reputation layers across different web3 protocols and platforms?
  • Impact of crypto as an information layer on product experiences and connections
  • Relevance and implications of social credentials

4:00 PM - 4:10 PM
Break

4:10 PM - 4:40 PM
Panel 4: Social networks in the age of Network States and AIPanelists: Mike, Primavera, Chika, Vitalik
Moderator: Afra

  • The A.I. dilemma - A.I. hacking our social codes - Quo vadis?
  • A chatbot future for social media - dystopia? Or the future paradigm?
  • A new diverse toolbox of social apps for network states & coodi-nation
  • How network states bring the humane side of community OR not

4:40 PM - 5:00 PM
Free discussion from the audience
This is a collective intelligence-sparking brainstorming 20-min for the Zuzalu community to envision the future of social.

name: An Architecture for Collective Intelligence
description:
Humanity has figured out enough technical solutions to achieve collective intelligence. Now we just need to piece them together into a whole. We propose a coordination protocol that's invariant to your perspective of the world, your values in that world, and the situation you're in. It seems more effective and efficient than money.

Speaker Bruno Zell is software engineer at Rabot  Energy. He is interested in the challenge of utilizing AI for the highest benefit of humanity.

name: Q&A with Aella: Fetish research and sex work
equipment: I'd like to sit on stage with a table for my laptop that's connected to the screen, and I'd also like a mic.
description:
I've worked as a sex worker (of varying sorts) for ten years, and also do a bunch of sex and fetish-oriented research, with what might be the largest, most comprehensive dataset in the world right now. I've paid a lot of strongly incentivized attention to How To Seduce Men More Efficiently (and how this interplays with the economic dynamics in the sex work world), as well as have lots of fun, only semi-graphic anecdotes.

If you want to ask any questions about anything related to these things, come ask me! There's no question too dumb or invasive. 

(Also, if you have specific things you're curious about, feel free to message me in advance on telegram @theaellagirl with your question so I can go find the answer in my dataset before the Q&A)

name: Stablecoin Maximalism: A New Framework To Understand DeFi
equipment: Will be giving a presentation from Mac. Need chairs.
description: It has been said that DeFi is merely computer nerds rediscovering the laws of economics. Over the past few years, we have been able to observe financial experiements of all kinds take place on-chain and have seen what works and what doesn't. In this presentation, I will be making the case for Stablecoin Maximalism, the idea that on a long-enough timeline every DeFi protocol will converge to become or deeply integrate a stablecoin.

name: The Class with Natalie Kuhn
equipment: full sound set up, Dome cleared of chairs
description:
What is The Class? The Class is a fun and challenging workout that combines strength-training, cardio, and mindfulness to help you feel better.

The practice is mat-based and music-driven. We repeat one move per song to create sensation in the body and observe our thoughts. In any given Class students can expect guided instruction and a carefully curated playlist to lead them through exercises they are familiar with such as—squats, jumping jacks, and burpees.


The result is a mental clearing and emotional release. Through continued practice, students develop tools to empower their life, along with an incredibly strong, resilient, body.

name: The Nuclear-Free Network State: Web3 and Nuclear Disarmament
equipment: Screen and projector and ability to play video (i.e. with sound).
description:
Workshop description

Nuclear weapons are an immediate, existential threat to humanity, and nuclear war is becoming more likely – including because AI could undermine nuclear deterrence.  Thousands of Russian and US nuclear missiles are ready to launch within half an hour and would start hitting their targets 30-45 minutes later. As well as killing hundreds of millions of people within hours, the climate impacts of a nuclear war could kill 5 billion people worldwide from starvation alone. PATH Collective  believes Web3 communities can help to address this existential threat.


The problem is that making nuclear weapons is very profitable. Part of the solution is therefore to make peace profitable, using decentralized security (DeSec) mechanisms to incentivize cooperation on nuclear threat reduction. Join PATH Collective for this discussion on how Web3’s decentralized social, financial, and governance tools could be used to create agency for citizens to help address nuclear and other existential threats, and to incentivize cooperation on these issues by making it profitable.


Workshop facilitator

Dr Lyndon Burford  is a nuclear weapons policy specialist and co-founder of PATH Collective, a startup working at the intersection of Web3 and humanitarian approaches to nuclear disarmament. PATH is working to bridge the Web3 and disarmament worlds, and to develop solutions that combine environmental monitoring with the decentralized finance and governance of Web3. The aim is to make phased, verified nuclear disarmament both possible and profitable.

name: Longevity Zero to One: General Biology
description:
Session 1: General Biology


Assuming zero background in biology, we quickly go over important concepts you will need to understand how and why we age, and how the interventions discussed in later sessions work. Topics:

  - Central dogma

  - Biomolecules

  - Biochemistry

  - Metabolism

  - Homeostasis

  - Cells, tissues, organs

  - Immune system

  - What we still don’t know about biology


About the course


Longevity Zero to One is a course designed to get you from zero biology to a general understanding of the intervention landscape and bottlenecks to progress. We emphasize on helping participants apply their existing skillsets to high-impact areas in longevity.


Attending all sessions is highly recommended.


If you don’t have a biology background, we strongly advise attending the 1st session (General Biology) and 2nd session (Aging Biology). If you do have a background in biology, feel free to skip the 1st session!

name: AI NPC that work for you in Game
equipment: Need to set up screen, figjam session
description:
Let's brainstorm ideas for a virtual RPG game design in which AI-controlled non-player characters (NPCs) have various superpowers that assist players in generating income within a virtual world called Zuland. These AI NPCs can provide a range of valuable services, such as teaching, legal counsel, writing, and designing. Some AI characters might rule over the island, while others manage or work for different entities. As human hosts, our role would be to guide their objectives, provide education, and adjust their tasks as necessary. The value created by these AI NPCs would be translated into tokens that players can use in the real world.

To further develop the concept, consider these sample questions:

  1. What is the narrative behind Zuland, and how can we weave an engaging story throughout the game?
  2. What unique names can we create for each region within Zuland, and how can we design these lands to reflect their distinct characteristics and purposes?
  • How can we start constructing our own AI characters that will coexist and collaborate within Zuland?

name: Network States - Onchain Multiplayer Game Launch
equipment: AV (simple microphone and projector) needed. Recording would be cool but not super important.
description:
Play as a network state in an onchain world with dynamic lore.

"Network States" is an on-chain game that combines GPT-4 text generation with MUD, an onchain game engine. Set in a world of network states and various political factions, the game is inspired by programming and discussions at Zuzalu.


As a player, you'll take on the role of a new network state, striving to expand your population and influence. "Network States" is a real-time strategy (RTS) game that fuels an evolving narrative as players develop their states and interact with others. Drawing inspiration from early collective worldbuilding games, such as Slobbovia (1972-1986).


Developed during our time at Zuzalu, "Network States" explores the potential for onchain games as engines for generative worldbuilding. Join to play or watch.

A.k.a How to inoculate against bad science and dubious claims.


Longevity has a long history of snake oil salesmen and overpromises. How do you tell good science from bad? This session covers common ways science is misinterpreted, misaligned, and what to watch out for as you navigate the longevity science landscape. 


Topics:

- Failed aging theories

- Reproducibility crisis

- Artisanal science

- Bad incentives

- Low impact work vs high impact work


About the course

Longevity Zero to One is a course designed to get you from zero biology to a general understanding of the intervention landscape and bottlenecks to progress. We on helping participants apply their existing skillsets to high-impact areas in longevity.


Attending all sessions is highly recommended.


If you don’t have a biology background, we highly recommend attending the 1st session (General Biology) and 2nd session (Aging Biology). If you do have a background in biology, feel free to skip the 1st session!

name: Coordi-Nations as a Commons-based alternative to Network States (closed session to those pre-registered)
description:
Must Apply to Attend
Extitutional workshop on Coordinations as a commons-based alternative to Network States. The workshop will be gathering around 20 to 30 people, who commit to participating for the whole week. Participants will include a mix of thinkers, visionaries, and practitioners involved in the theorization, conceptualisation or implementation of post-westphalian sovereign communities, at the local and global level. 

If you are interested in attending, please submit an application at the following link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfhARucL3wPZV6qJcOUWQt1mjUuBJ1Mldb7ZOw1JQrmUjDv4Q/viewform

To give you an idea of what to expect for the schedule: 

* THEORY (May 9): Theoretical and conceptual work on post-Westphalian types of sovereignties, relationship to existing systems & institutions. 

* EMPIRICAL (May 10): Comparative analysis of previous and current attempts at implementing sovereign and post-westphalian communities

* PRACTICAL (May 11): Practical cookbook: Elaborate how to set up and manage a Coordi-Nation, similar to Balaji's step-by-step process for creating Network States. 

* TECHNICAL (May 12): Technical specification of relevant tools necessary to ensure the proper operations of these new sovereign communities.

* EXTITUTIONAL THEORY (May 13): Coordi-Nation as an alternative institutional scaffolding to support the agency of networked Nations, which transcend political authority beyond geographical boundaries.

name: The Beginning of Animal Free Precision Medicine 🐭
equipment: Microphone and sound, chairs for people to sit in
description:
Panel Description

What is Animal Free Precision Medicine (AFPM) and how will it disrupt healthcare and longevity? Join leaders from Methuselah Foundation, Center for Contemporary Sciences, and Lockwood Films as we discuss how animal free precision medicine will change the game for how drugs are discovered, tested, and delivered that will benefit patients and outcomes in the years to come.

Aysha Akhtar

Aysha Akhtar, M.D., M.P.H., is the co-founder and CEO of Center for Contemporary Sciences. She is a double-board certified neurologist and preventive medicine specialist, with a background in public health, and is a U.S veteran. Previously she served as Deputy Director of the U.S. Army Traumatic Brain Injury Program. As a Commander in the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, Dr. Akhtar frequently deployed to assist with national public health emergencies.
For a decade, Aysha was a Medical Officer at the Food and Drug Administration, most recently in the Office of Counterterrorism and Emerging Threats, implementing studies on vaccine effectiveness and safety and using her Top Secret Security Clearance to develop national preparedness strategies for public health threats.

Dane Gobel

Dane co-founded the Methuselah Foundation, NASA’s allied organization for the Deep Space Food Challenge, of which Dane supports as program director. Methuselah Foundation is dedicated to supporting healthy human life extension research by incubating and sponsoring mission-critical ventures, scientific research, and competition prizes to accelerate breakthroughs in healthy human life extension.

name: Open-source Vaccines to Prevent Pandemics and Mitigate The End of Medicine
description:
In a world facing rising pandemic risk and the unceasing advance of mutli-drug resistant bacteria that our current stock of antibiotics cannot combat, in no small part due to the execcess of the global animal agriculture system, we must massively increase our investment in disease prevention. Vaccines designed to be broadly-protective against entire families of high-risk pathogens so as to preempt and mitigate the emergence of new disease risks are just now becoming possible with the help of novel computational antigen design strategies and fast-iteration nucleic acid platforms.

Soham Sankaran from PopVax (https://popvax.com), an Indian mRNA vaccine company based in Hyderabad currently in the process of taking its pan-betacoronavirus vaccine candidate into US clinical trials this year, will talk about their approach to designing and manufacturing these broadly-protective vaccines, as well as their commitment to open-sourcing their designs and processes in order to ensure comprehensive low-cost global access to these medicines without delay, in particular in lower-income countries which are generally the last to be able to benefit from new medical advances.

name: How Plant Based Meals, Movements, & Mindsets Can Cure Disease 🥗
description:
Dr. Chidi is a Doctor trained in Surgery, General Practice & Lifestyle Medicine at Cambridge, UCL & Johns Hopkins USA. He is a Founding Director of the European Society of Lifestyle Medicine (now ELMO). He has over 20 years of experience as a national and international Health and Wellness speaker including a TEDx talk on Reversing Disease (2013).

He has advised the current UK Government and opposition party on Covid19 and its effects on different ethnic groups. He is working with GP groups in London to reverse diabetes in their patients. He continues to advise the Nigerian Federal Government on health issues.

name: Summit Closing: Threats To Longevity In Our Food System 🫀
description:
A summary of the summit and the topics covered, along with an insider's perspective on how animal use affects every aspect of our lives without us realizing. 


Dr. Alice Brough comes from a farming background, and worked as a commercial pig veterinarian from 2015-2019. Her time in the meat industry opened her eyes to the crises being created by our food system, and she now works full-time on averting these through consultancy and activism.

name: Muse Dinner
description:
Muse dinner returns! This program pairs you with a stranger and gives you a conversation menu of topics to choose from. The idea is originally developed by the cultural historian Theodore Zeldin, and aims to provide a transformative bonding experience.


Vibe check:

Tonight you don't need to share your resume or impress anyone. It is common knowledge that you are great and your matched partner will know that already. 

What's interesting tonight is your half-baked parts; the stuff you're still figuring out. And if at any point you find yourself slipping into preplanned speeches remember, instead, to try to look for the words and thoughts that you are still forming.

name: The Road to Longevity: Raising Awareness
equipment: Screen, projector and laptop. Chairs like frontal lecture.
description:
If we wish to reach longevity escape velocity, it is essential for us to raise public awareness and inspire millions to join the quest. We can learn a lot from past dreams of humanity for longer life, from paleolithic times to modern society. We will discuss current sociological studies about contemporary sentiments towards life extension. Finally, we will equip ourselves with effective arguments and strategies for raising awareness and community building. 

Martin Lipovšek, MPhil, is a board member of the International Longevity Alliance, the president of the Slovenian Society for Vital Life Extension, and a PhD candidate in philosophy, with a research focus on transhuman longevity. He has delivered multiple public lectures, spoken at international conferences, and given a TEDx talk on the topic of life extension.

description:
New forms of social organizing are possible, but who is capable of designing the kind of civilization we want? No one of us, only all of us, together. Global Unity is developing SocietyOS — a crowd-sourced civilization design platform. Rather than wait until the platform is ready, SocietyOS workshops allow us to share our ideas, visions, and pathways to getting to the kind of society and civilization we want.

Join us, share your voice, hear from others, and let's design something better together.

name: Advancing Lifespan: Phased Wave Innovations in Laser and Ultrasound Technologies
description: Can we see more deeply than an MRI can into our own bodies, using consumer-grade tech, from the comfort and privacy of our homes? This talk explores the cutting-edge advancements of phased wave technologies, leveraging the micron-level precision of lasers and ultrasound, with immense potential to redefine not only disease diagnosis but also treatment, and to extend human lifespans equitably across the board. I'll share compelling outcomes in curing aggressive cancers, stroke, and clinical depression utilizing a singular, cost-efficient non-invasive device. Additionally, we have compelling evidence that this same approach can be used to neutralize pathogens, to attenuate inflammation and prevent inflammatory cascades (eg cytokine storms), and to investigate and control neurodegenerative disease. Please join us for a discussion about an approach that could soon become a pillar of decentralized healthcare and DIY longevity. This could be precision medicine for everybody.

name: Viruses staying in the human body long-term: drivers of aging
description:
This talk by Amy Proal, PhD (PolyBio Research Foundation) will explain how humans are holobionts comprising trillions of microbial and viral organisms whose collective functioning impacts biological signaling. The viral component of this holobiont is referred to as the “human virome.” This virome contains bacteriophage and DNA/RNA viruses. Bacteriophage are viruses that infect bacteria and modulate their activity, and trillions of bacteriophage traffic human tissue and blood at any given moment. 


 


However, despite the fact that human and virus biology is intricately connected, certain DNA and RNA virome members such as herpesviruses can contribute to diseases of aging and inflammaging. These viruses have evolved a wide range of mechanisms to directly hijack the activity of the human genome, the human immune response, and human metabolism. For example, the amyloid beta “plaque” that accumulates in the Alzheimer’s brain is now being studied as a peptide that forms in response to viral pathogens in brain tissue[1].


 


Persistent viruses can also disrupt human signaling directly connected to aging processes. For example, one network analysis uncovered dozens of viruses encoding proteins experimentally demonstrated to interact with proteins from pathways associated with human aging, including cellular senescence[2]. Viral infection can also have profound effects on host cell processes relevant to telomere biology and genome maintenance[3], with human herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6) capable of driving telomere dysfunction by directly integrating into host telomeric DNA.


 


Human virome-driven contributions to aging processes may be rapidly accelerating due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The SARS-CoV-2 virus driving the COVID-19 pandemic is increasingly being studied as a virus capable of long-term persistence in a wide range of human body and brain sites[4]. We may consequently be seeding the human population with yet one more virus that can drive human genome, metabolic and senescence-related dysfunction under certain conditions.


 


It follows that the rapid development of novel antiviral drugs, immunotherapies, and prophylactics could help control virome activity in a manner that should promote human longevity. However, development and use of these novel therapeutics must be done with great transparency. The general public must be fully engaged in the process, so that potential side effects and the “risk-reward” ratios for certain therapeutics can be thoughtfully evaluated and debated. 


 


References:


 


1. Eimer WA, Vijaya Kumar DK, Navalpur Shanmugam NK, et al. Alzheimer’s Disease-Associated β-Amyloid Is Rapidly Seeded by Herpesviridae to Protect against Brain Infection. Neuron. 2018;99(1):56. doi:10.1016/J.NEURON.2018.06.030


2. Teulière J, Bernard C, Bonnefous H, Martens J, Lopez P, Bapteste E. Interactomics: Dozens of Viruses, Co-evolving With Humans, Including the Influenza A Virus, may Actively Distort Human Aging. Mol Biol Evol. 2023;40(2). doi:10.1093/MOLBEV/MSAD012


3. Deng Z, Wang Z, Lieberman PM. Telomeres and viruses: common themes of genome maintenance. Front Oncol. 2012;2. doi:10.3389/FONC.2012.00201


4. Stein SR, Ramelli SC, Grazioli A, et al. SARS-CoV-2 infection and persistence in the human body and brain at autopsy. Nature 2022 612:7941. 2022;612(7941):758-763. doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05542-y

name: GlycanAge testing
description:
Get your ticket: https://lu.ma/of9x31mp 


You've heard a lot about biomarkers and biological age tests already but GlycanAge is truly unique among alternatives. Based on cutting-edge technology, three decades of research and over 200,000 samples, this biomarker integrates genetic, epigenetic and environmental aspects of ageing, responds to lifestyle interventions and is proven to be the best predictor of future health outcomes (detecting risk from disease 10 years in advance!).


The secret behind it are glycans - complex sugar molecules which exist on every cell surface and are highly responsive to lifestyle changes. In fact, glycans detect and measure chronic inflammation, the most significant cause of death globally.


Join us on Saturday to learn more about the most revolutionary tool for prevention and get your glycans tested. You can then expect your GlycanAge results in 4-6 weeks. Not only that, but you will also have a 1:1 discussion with one of GlycanAge care specialist where you will look at your results in more detail, find out what are the current sources of inflammation in your body and what specific changes/ interventions will help you slow down aging.

name: IMMORTALIST - Movie Night
equipment: Movie Streaming Capabilities, Room full of chairs
description:
As part of the Longevity Biotech Conference we have a Movie Evening Program.

IMMORTALIST 

We would like to invite you to a special screening of the first-ever feature film about transhumanism, the longevity community, and cryonics based on a true story. The movie features the legendary Franco Nero as Paolo, a man dying of terminal cancer. His grandson Max (played by Jeff DuJardin), the founder of an anti-aging company, is determined to save his beloved 'Papa' using cryonics – the technique of deep-freezing the bodies of people who have just died in the hope that they can be revived in the future. However, Max's mother (played by Sherilyn Fenn), a single, alcoholic, and wandering Catholic, believes that Max's plan is immoral and barbaric and insists on a traditional funeral. This sets the stage for a battle over Paolo's immortality


Cast 

The legend of the anti-aging movement  Aubrey de Grey played himself there, as well as world-famous actors such as Sherilyn Fenn (Twin Peaks of David Lynch,  nominee for a Golden Globe Award and an Emmy Award), Franco Nero (Django), comedian/actor Paul Rodriguez and Aries Spears.   


Wins and nominations  https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11388604/awards/?ref_=tt_awd

The teaser https://vimeo.com/523042372 


Producer  Vladislav Alex Kozlov  vladkozlov76@yahoo.com

name: Kernel Junto - Debt
description:
Kernel is a community of people dedicated to learning together.

"Junto" means "together" in Spanish. It is a conversation for mutual improvement around specific and relevant topics.

We think more clearly when we are together, especially when we gather with people who practice honesty and humility. We see ourselves most clearly reflected in the eyes of those who are value and cultivate the ability truly to listen to one another.

I will host a series of these over the final days of Zuzalu.

The first junto will be on Debt. We will split into small groups of at most 4 people to discuss what debt is and how we can understand it in our time.

name: [Lunch + Learn] Options Trading by Cega
equipment:
We will need:
- Lunch catering
- Tables
- Projector
- USB-C cable to project

description:
In any emerging capital markets, derivatives form in order to accelerate liquidity. In this session, we will organize a brown bag lunch & learn session to go through option trading basics and discuss why these concepts would help drive economic initiatives in emerging economies.

Arisa (twitter.com/arisatoyo) is a co-founder of Cega. Cega is building exotic options structured products for investors that generate superior yield and offer built-in protection against market downturns. Cega is developing new capabilities in tech, token contracts, and data modeling around DeFi derivatives. Arisa is a former options trader.

description:
Inclusion Is A Verb

Zuzalu is an incredible environment that has not only done a wonderful job bringing good people together from across the world, it has done so while creating a safe, inviting, inclusive environment. And yet the question remains, is there more we can do? Come join this discussion where we will explore what Zuzalu and the wider Web3 community is doing right and how we can go even further to make sure everyone here not only feels welcomed and safe, but valued and included.

Panelists: 

Chika Uwazie - Afropolitan
Eric Annan - Aya
Elliott Bayev - Global Unity

description:
Are you ready to roll up your sleeves, put on your apron, and join us for a fun-filled evening of cooking, laughter, and delicious food with the whoooole Zuzalu community?

Whether you're a seasoned chef or a beginner cook, this is the perfect opportunity to showcase your culinary skills, learn from others, and have obvious fun!!!

We will provide all the necessary ingredients and equipment, all you need to bring is your enthusiasm and willingness to have fun. Our kitchen takeover cooking experience will be filled with challenges, surprises, and lots of laughter, so come prepared for a wild ride.

And if you don’t want to cook, showing up for dinner is also perfect. Get ready to join us for a night of craziness in the kitchen. We can't wait to see you there!

name: Bringing African Developers To The World - Zuzalu ChangeMaker Interview Series with Eric Annan
description:
Aya is a Web3 talent marketplace and training platform that that connects African talent with opportunities from across the world.

Much of the proof of the value of crypto and web3 has been demonstrated through usage in Africa, and Aya aims to ensure that Africans get to actually participate in and benefit from the web3 boom. Hear the story of resilient non-technical Aya founder Eric Annan on how he built Aya to unlock adoption of Web3 skills and opportunities in Africa, why it is so important, what challenges they have been facing, and how you can help support.

name: Foresight Existential Hope salon
description:
Join us for the Zuzalu edition of Foresight's salon series using an Existential Hope lens on civilization's potential.    

We explore existential risk vs existential hope, small kills all risk from tech, differential tech development, top down-vs. bottom-up solutions, resilience, escape, and more.   

After intros on Xhope concepts, we invite you to find aligned minds to breakout according to topics, that may include: Utopias, Protopias, Paretotopias Solving Coordination Failures, Value Evolution, Drift, Convergence Positive Futures in Security, Computing, AI Progress Positive Futures in Bio, Nano, Neurotech Progress Positive Futures in Climate, Energy, Space Progress.

We'll gather for a report-out, followed by more time for connection.  

Light drinks and light snacks will be served but any additions are always appreciated <3  

About Foresight Institute: Foresight Institute supports the beneficial development of high-impact technology to make great futures more likely. We focus on science and technology that is too early-stage or interdisciplinary for legacy institutions to support, such as biotech, neurotech, nanotech, space & computing.  

More about Foresight: https://foresight.org  

More about Existential Hope: https://www.existentialhope.com

name: John Cage (silent) party
description:
We invite you to a John Cage party. Wednesday, 7 pm, D111 apartment 

John Cage was an American composer. One of his most famous pieces is 4′33″ (“four minutes, thirty-three seconds” or just “four thirty-three”).

It was composed in 1952 for any instrument or combination of instruments, and the score instructs performers not to play their instruments during the entire duration of the piece throughout the three movements. So, that is four minutes, thirty-three seconds of silence.

John Cage claimed that 4‘33‘‘ was his most important work. That is… His most important work, in his own words, was nothing.

John Cage party (or silent parity) is a party where words are not allowed. Literally: no single word for no single person. If you come, you take an agreement to stay silent until you leave the party. 

Consider it as a social experiment, unfacilitated meditation, or a trusted block box. 

We will cook a couple of dessert options (one vegan and one regular). Feel free to bring a drink or snack for yourself if you want. 

If you have any questions feel free to ask @l_girll on tg.

name: Zuzalu Hivemind Day
description:
Haven't spoken yet at Zuzalu but want to share your ideas, projects, research? Here's your chance!


Apply here to speak: https://forms.gle/XnXNfaWSoS1Wcxu28

 

You are qualified to speak ONLY if: 

1.  You have yet to have a solo presentation at Zuzalu. Bonus points if you’ve never had a solo exhibit before

Or

2.  You are speaking about a topic that has not been discussed yet here at Zuzalu

You may talk about any topic. Here are some examples:

- Your own project, the research you’ve done, work

- An idea, a thought process

- Some hobbies, funny topics, etc. (i.e., even smt like how to solve a Rubic’s cube)

- Your life story, a fun story

We encourage you to be creative and do more than just a slide presentation. Here are some ideas:

- Whiteboard

- Encouraging discussion

- Breakout sessions

- Bring the audience on stage, participation from the audience

- A workshop

name: WHY DOES AFROPOLITAN NEED TO EXIST
description:
Join us for an engaging discussion at Zuzalu as we explore the vital question: Why Afropolitan Needs to Exist. 🌍✨
https://afropolitan.io/manifesto


As Africans, we understand the importance of freedom—freedom to transact, freedom to travel, and freedom to build. These three key themes will take center stage as we delve into the significance of the Afropolitan movement from an African perspective.


During this thought-provoking session, we'll discuss how Afropolitan empowers us to reclaim our economic sovereignty by providing the freedom to transact. We'll explore the transformative power of accessing new markets, connecting with global partners, and embracing innovative technologies that enable us to build a prosperous future.


Furthermore, we'll delve into the power of the Afropolitan community in granting us the freedom to travel. By breaking down borders, fostering cultural exchange, and creating opportunities for global citizenship, we'll unveil how Afropolitan opens doors to new experiences, networks, and collaborations.


Lastly, we'll emphasize the freedom to build. From entrepreneurship to infrastructure development, we'll explore how Afropolitan enables us to create sustainable businesses, vibrant communities, and transformative projects that shape our future.


Join us at Zuzalu for this enlightening discussion as we collectively examine the essence of why Afropolitan Needs to Exist. Don't miss this opportunity to contribute to the narrative and be part of the movement that empowers Africans to thrive, prosper, and shape their destiny.

name: Muse Gelato 🍧 (Speed Friending Version)
description:
Come and join us for a speed-friending version of Muse dinner - Muse Gelato.

Here's what we'll do:


- Everyone grabs a gelato 🍧 and finds a seat

- You have 5 minutes to chat with the person sitting opposite you. We suggest each person answers a question from the Muse menu

- After 5 minutes, move to the next chair in a clockwise direction, and so on

- After 70 minutes, the conversation ends

- Write an anonymous message for the person who impressed you the most


*The conversation at a marked table will be recorded. The video will be edited and later shared on the Zuzalu social channel. If you do not want to appear in the video, you can choose to skip this table.

name: How We Unite Humanity
description: Global Unity has developed a strategy and design set intended to facilitate new forms of global coordination and collaboration. Come hear about the vision, strategy, and traction we have achieved. More than 50 Zuzalians are already part of the more than 400+ person strong community of change-makers, technologists, social entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, and community leaders who have heard and are supporting this mission. Come be one of the first to hear the plan, share your reflections, ideas, and critiques, and let's build something better together.

name: SocietyOS: Crowdsourcing Civilization Designs Workshop
description:
New forms of social organizing are possible, but who is capable of designing the kind of civilization we want? No one of us, only all of us, together. Global Unity is developing SocietyOS — a crowd-sourced civilization design platform. Rather than wait until the platform is ready, SocietyOS workshops allow us to share our ideas, visions, and pathways to getting to the kind of society and civilization we want.

Join us, share your voice, hear from others, and let's design something better together.

name: Muse Dance Party
info: chairs cleared
description:
If the Oxford Muse Dinner had a baby with a dance party, this would be it! We will combine the joy of movement and the power of vulnerability to foster deep connections and authentic human interactions.

We will start with a dynamic and energizing dance session, where you'll be invited to move freely and let your body express itself without any judgment or inhibition.

We will gradually introduce the element of vulnerability by pairing participants off and inviting them to answer questions. These questions are designed to create a safe and supportive environment where you can share your thoughts, feelings, and experiences with others who are open and receptive to listening.

You'll leave the event feeling inspired, uplifted, and connected to a community of like-minded people who share your desire for authentic human connections.

This is a welcoming and inclusive space for anyone who wants to explore the power of vulnerability and connection through dance. Come join us and let your heart beat to the rhythm of life!
